intro: Polydictyum variabile, commonly known as the variable polydictyum, is a species of aquatic plant belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, branching stems and small, whorled leaves that are often submerged in water. The plant produces tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are typically found in the water, often in clusters. It thrives in freshwater environments such as ponds, lakes, and slow-moving streams. Its adaptability to varying water conditions makes it a common sight in many aquatic habitats.
